The facility is not maintaining medical records for vaccinations. At the time of inspection, the facility was unable to provide
the APHIS inspector documentation of the distemper and parvovirus vaccine status of 23 adult dogs. The result of this
was either the dogs appeared to have never been vaccinated, not up to date, or had no documentation of completion of
their puppy series of vaccines. The Program of Vet Care (PVC) prescribes for puppies to receive the parvovirus vaccine
at 4, 6, 8, 12, and 16 weeks of age, and for the distemper vaccine at 6, 10, and 14 weeks of age. Then both vaccines are
to be given yearly to adult dogs.
Proper medical record documentation is a requirement of the Animal Welfare Act under §3.13(b). Failure to provide this
documentation prohibits the APHIS inspector’s ability to verify that the facility is following the Program of Vet Care as
prescribed by the Attending Veterinarian and to ensure the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care in a timely and
appropriate manner.
Dealers must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. The records
must include the information in the regulations under §3.13(b), including but not limited to the identity of the animal, the
names of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by: May 7, 2025, onward
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
